>>Does everybody deal with this? I know I do!!! STILL - with my 18 yo,
>>even!!!>>

Well we certainly deal with it here. I've read a bit of what you've written
about your oldest. I've seen many similarities to Casey in there. That means
your daughter(s) MUST be fabulous! :o)

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschooling,what a concept! was Re: OH!.. THATS the answer.. silly me
messages.msgSnippet: ... Does everybody deal with this? I know I do!!!  STILL - with my 18 yo, even!!! My kids are all extremely emotional - very dramatic, lots and lots of joy and
messages.messageBody:
On Saturday, February 15, 2003, at 10:03 AM, Tia Leschke wrote:

>
>> So, yes, I understand extremes. I just try VERY hard to not let her
> emotions
>> become my emotions.
>
> I've never heard it said quite this way. Thanks, Mary.

Does everybody deal with this? I know I do!!! STILL - with my 18 yo,
even!!!
My kids are all extremely emotional - very dramatic, lots and lots of
joy and sadness and anger around here!!! It can be exhausting. And
overwhelming for other people to be around us <G>.


--pam


Pam Sorooshian
The National Home Education Network
~The World is Our Classroom~
www.NHEN.org

messages.msgSnippet: ... emotions ... I ve never heard it said quite this way.  Thanks, Mary. Tia
messages.messageBody:
> So, yes, I understand extremes. I just try VERY hard to not let her
emotions
> become my emotions.

I've never heard it said quite this way. Thanks, Mary.
Tia
